name: Piña Verde
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
2. Strain into rocks glass over pebble ice.
3. Garnish with a mint sprig.
description: This Piña Colada riff relies on Green Chartreuse rather than rum. Pineapple juice and lime add a fruity kick, and Coco Lopez adds coconut.

ingredients.name: Green Chartreuse
ingredients.description: Green Chartreuse is a herbal liqueur made by the Carthusian monks in France. It is known for its vibrant green color and complex flavor profile derived from a secret blend of 130 herbs and botanicals. Green Chartreuse has a strong and distinct taste, featuring herbal, floral, and spicy notes. It has a high alcohol content, typically 55% ABV (alcohol by volume). Green Chartreuse can be enjoyed on its own as a digestif or used in cocktails for its unique and intense flavor.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Cream of Coconut
ingredients.description: Coconut cream is a thick, rich, and smooth substance extracted from the flesh of mature coconuts. Coconut cream is similar to coconut milk, but it has a higher concentration of coconut solids, giving it a thicker consistency. It is often used in both savory and sweet recipes, including curries, soups, desserts, and beverages. Coconut cream is a key ingredient in many dishes in Southeast Asian, Caribbean, and other tropical cuisines.
